name: Sahara Desert
hint: Largest hot desert in the world, spanning most of North Africa

name: Kalahari Desert
hint: Large semi-arid savanna in southern Africa, home to the San people

name: Congo Rainforest
hint: Second-largest tropical rainforest in the world, in Central Africa

name: Serengeti
hint: Famous ecosystem in Tanzania known for the great wildebeest migration

name: Great Rift Valley
hint: Massive geological trench running from Lebanon to Mozambique through East Africa

name: Namib Desert
hint: Oldest desert in the world, along the coast of Namibia with towering red dunes

name: Sahel
hint: Semi-arid transitional zone between the Sahara and the savanna to the south

name: Madagascar Rainforest
hint: Unique rainforest on the world's fourth-largest island, home to lemurs

name: Okavango Delta
hint: Largest inland delta in the world, in Botswana, never reaches the ocean

name: Ethiopian Highlands
hint: Rugged mountain mass in northeastern Africa, sometimes called the Roof of Africa

name: Cape of Good Hope
hint: Rocky headland in South Africa near the continent's southern tip, feared by early sailors

name: Strait of Gibraltar
hint: Narrow waterway separating Africa from Europe, only 14 km wide at its narrowest

name: Suez Canal
hint: Artificial waterway in Egypt connecting the Mediterranean to the Red Sea

name: Nile Delta
hint: Fertile fan-shaped river delta in Egypt where the Nile meets the Mediterranean

name: Victoria Falls
hint: Spectacular waterfall on the Zambezi, locals call it 'The Smoke That Thunders'

name: Horn of Africa
hint: Peninsula in East Africa shaped like a rhinoceros horn, includes Somalia and Djibouti

name: Mozambique Channel
hint: Arm of the Indian Ocean between Madagascar and mainland southeastern Africa

name: Gulf of Guinea
hint: Large gulf of the Atlantic Ocean along the west coast of Africa near the equator

name: Danakil Depression
hint: One of the hottest and lowest places on Earth, in Ethiopia with colorful acid pools

name: Fish River Canyon
hint: Second-largest canyon in the world after the Grand Canyon, in southern Namibia
